name: Abertay International Scholarship
requirements: Must be classified as International for fee purposes; minimum academic entry requirements equivalent to BBC at A-Level; must have accepted an offer of study for a full-time undergraduate degree; cannot be combined with other Abertay scholarships.
description: Abertay's primary award for high-achieving international students. The scholarship is paid as a £3,000 reduction in tuition fees per year for up to four years of study (total £12,000), aimed at supporting diverse talent in Dundee.

name: Abertay International Scholarship
requirements: Must be classified as International for fee purposes; hold a 2:1 or equivalent in a relevant undergraduate degree; admission to a full-time Postgraduate Taught (PGT) program; personal statement required for specific competitive subjects.
description: A merit-based one-off tuition fee reduction for international postgraduate students. This award is designed to attract top global graduates to Abertay's world-leading specialized programs in Cyber Security and Game Design.

name: International Graduate Network (IGN) Scholarship
eligibility: Non-UK students who graduated from Aberystwyth
requirements: Must have successfully completed a full undergraduate degree at Aberystwyth University; must be self-funding; must apply for a full-time Postgraduate Taught program starting in 2026; no separate application form is required.
description: A loyalty-based discount for international alumni of Aberystwyth. It offers a 10% reduction on the tuition fees for a full-time Master's degree, recognizing the continued contribution of international graduates to the university community.

name: International Excellence Scholarship
requirements: High academic achievement in previous studies (equivalent to AAB at A-Level); must be an international fee-payer; submission of a 500-word personal statement justifying academic merit and leadership potential; must hold an offer of study.
description: A prestigious merit-based award providing £2,000 per year for up to 3 or 4 years. It is designed to reward the most academically gifted international students across all disciplines at Aberystwyth.

name: International Merit Scholarship
requirements: Must be an international student starting a full-time undergraduate degree; must be self-funding; academic excellence based on high school results (B-average or higher equivalent); automatic assessment upon application to the university.
description: An automatic merit-based award designed to support talented international students. The scholarship provides a one-off £2,000 reduction in the first year of tuition fees to help students transition to life in Cambridge or Chelmsford.

name: International Merit Scholarship
requirements: Must be an international student starting a full-time postgraduate taught degree; must be self-funding; minimum 2:1 undergraduate degree or equivalent; automatic assessment at the point of admission.
description: A one-off tuition fee reduction of £2,000 for international Master's students. This award is part of ARU's commitment to making global education more accessible for high-performing students across its business and technology faculties.

name: Arden University Regional Scholarship
requirements: Must be a resident of an eligible region (e.g. Nigeria, Ghana, Pakistan); must apply for an undergraduate blended learning or online program; must demonstrate how the degree will benefit their local community in a 300-word statement.
description: Arden offers region-specific bursaries to support students from developing economies. This award reduces the 2026 tuition fees to make modern, flexible learning more affordable for international career-switchers.

name: AUB International Scholarship
requirements: Must be an international fee-payer; submission of a high-quality creative portfolio; must hold an offer of study for a full-time BA (Hons) degree; 500-word statement on 'How AUB will help me change the creative industry'.
description: This competitive award recognizes exceptional creative talent. It provides a £5,000 reduction in the first year of tuition for undergraduate students who show significant potential in arts, design, or media.

name: AUB International Scholarship
requirements: Hold an international fee-paying status; minimum 2:1 degree in a related creative field; strong digital portfolio submission; must be a full-time Master's applicant at the Bournemouth campus.
description: A merit-based scholarship for international postgraduates aimed at fostering global perspectives within the AUB studio environment. The award is a £3,000 one-off reduction in the total Master's tuition fee.

name: Creative Academic Merit Scholarship
requirements: Must be classified as International for fee purposes; Minimum entry requirements equivalent to BBC at A-Level or equivalent; Submission of a digital portfolio demonstrating high creative potential; Acceptance of a full-time BA (Hons) offer.
description: Awarded to incoming international undergraduates at Arts University Plymouth who demonstrate exceptional creative talent and academic promise. This scholarship provides a one-off tuition fee reduction in the first year of study to help foster global artistic diversity.

name: Aston Global Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Open to students from all countries outside the UK; Must hold an offer for a full-time Undergraduate program; Awarded based on academic achievement (equivalent to AAB at A-Level); Submission of a 500-word personal statement on career goals.
description: Aston’s flagship merit-based award designed to support the most academically gifted international students. The value is tiered based on the strength of the application and is applied as a reduction in the first year's tuition fees.

name: Aston Global Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a taught Master’s degree (excluding MBA); Hold a 2:1 or equivalent in a relevant undergraduate degree; Applicants must demonstrate leadership potential and commitment to their chosen industry through a personal statement.
description: A prestigious award for international postgraduates aimed at attracting top global talent to Birmingham. It provides a significant reduction in tuition fees to assist high-achievers in specializing within Aston's business, engineering, and health faculties.

name: Vice-Chancellor Scholarship
requirements: Must have applied for a full-time undergraduate degree; Outstanding academic achievement (equivalent to A*AA at A-Level); Separate scholarship application required; Must demonstrate commitment to becoming an ambassador for Bangor University.
description: A highly competitive award for the most exceptional international applicants. The scholarship provides a total of £10,000 (split over the duration of the course) to recognize and reward academic excellence and leadership.

name: International Scholarship
requirements: Automatic assessment based on admission application; Hold a 2:1 or 1st class honors degree (or international equivalent); Must be a self-funding student; Available for most taught Master's programs.
description: An automatic merit-based award for international postgraduates. The value of the scholarship is determined by the applicant's prior academic performance, with higher awards given to those with first-class degrees.

name: Global Citizen Scholarship
requirements: Must be an international fee-payer; Completion of a separate application form; 500-word statement demonstrating how the applicant will contribute to the Global Citizen community at Bath Spa; Must hold a conditional or unconditional offer.
description: Designed to support students who demonstrate a commitment to internationalization and community engagement. This award provides a first-year tuition fee reduction to help talented creative and humanities students join the Bath Spa community.

name: Global Citizen Scholarship
requirements: Available for full-time taught Master’s students; Minimum 2:1 degree or equivalent; Applicants must detail their future career plans and how they align with Bath Spa’s mission of sustainability and creativity.
description: A merit-based award for international postgraduate students. The scholarship aims to alleviate the financial burden of international fees for students who show strong potential to influence their respective fields globally.

name: BIMM Global Scholarship
requirements: Must be an international student enrolled in a full-time performance or production degree; High standard of musical proficiency demonstrated via audition or portfolio; Must hold an offer from a BIMM campus (e.g. London, Bristol).
description: Specifically for international musicians and producers, this award supports students coming to the UK to study music. It serves as a partial tuition fee reduction based on the technical and creative merit of the applicant.

name: Birkbeck Global Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Must be an international fee-payer; Must have accepted an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; Selection is based on academic merit from previous qualifications; Applicants must be self-funded and not sponsored by a government or employer.
description: A merit-based award designed to support high-achieving international students entering Birkbeck's evening-study focused programs. The value is applied as a one-off reduction in the first-year tuition fees to recognize global academic potential.

name: Birkbeck Global Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Must be a new international student for a taught Master’s degree (MA, MSc, LLM); Hold a minimum 2:1 or equivalent undergraduate degree; Automatic consideration for some regions, others require a 400-word personal statement on academic goals.
description: Birkbeck's flagship postgraduate award for international students. It aims to reduce the financial barrier for global graduates wishing to study in the heart of London, with tiered values based on the applicant's academic standing and professional experience.

name: BCU International Academic Scholarship
requirements: Must be a self-funding international student; Awarded automatically to students with high entry grades (equivalent to ABB at A-Level); Must hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree at the Birmingham campus.
description: An automatic merit-based tuition fee reduction for incoming international undergraduates. This scholarship is part of BCU’s commitment to rewarding academic excellence and supporting students from diverse global backgrounds in Birmingham.

name: BCU International Academic Scholarship
requirements: Available for all self-funding international students on a full-time taught Master’s; Automatic award for those holding a first-class degree equivalent; No separate application is required as eligibility is assessed during admissions.
description: A one-off tuition fee reduction for the most academically gifted international postgraduates. It is designed to attract top-tier global talent to Birmingham City University’s creative, business, and health-related Master's programs.

name: International Student Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time degree; Minimum academic requirements equivalent to BCC at A-Level; Must submit a 300-word statement on how they will contribute to the Newman community; Available for all non-clinical subjects.
description: A targeted award for international students at Birmingham Newman University. It focuses on students who demonstrate not only academic merit but a commitment to the university's values of social justice and community service.

name: BU International Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Must be an international fee-payer; Awarded for academic excellence (equivalent to AAB at A-Level); Must be a new student entering a full-time undergraduate course; Automatic assessment at the point of application.
description: A prestigious award that recognizes the high achievements of international students. The scholarship provides a £3,500 reduction in tuition fees for the first year, making Bournemouth a more accessible destination for global talent.

name: BU Academic Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Must hold a minimum 2:1 undergraduate degree or international equivalent; Admission to a full-time taught Master’s program; Automatic assessment upon admission; Students must not be receiving any other BU scholarship or discount.
description: A merit-based award designed to attract high-performing graduates to Bournemouth. It provides a £3,500 reduction in the total Master's tuition fee, supporting specialization in media, hospitality, and environmental sciences.

name: Brunel Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Available to students from any international country; Must hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; High academic grades (typically AAB or equivalent); Separate scholarship application form and 500-word statement required.
description: One of Brunel's most valuable awards for international students, providing a £6,000 tuition fee reduction in the first year. It is awarded to students who demonstrate exceptional academic achievement and potential to represent Brunel globally.

name: Brunel Graduate Discount
requirements: Must have graduated with an undergraduate or postgraduate degree from Brunel University London; Must be self-funding; Admission to a full-time or part-time taught Master’s degree starting in 2026; No separate application required.
description: A loyalty discount for Brunel alumni, providing a 15% reduction in tuition fees for further study. It encourages lifelong learning and supports Brunel graduates in advancing their professional skills within the same academic community.

name: BNU Vice-Chancellor’s International Scholarship
requirements: Must be a self-funding international student; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate program; academic achievement equivalent to BBC at A-Level; no separate application required as assessment is automatic based on admission documents.
description: A merit-based award designed to support international students joining Buckinghamshire New University. The scholarship provides a one-off reduction in the first-year tuition fee to recognize academic potential and ease the transition to UK higher education.

name: International Student Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree at Canterbury Christ Church; must be a new student to the university; based on academic merit from prior qualifications; available across most subject areas excluding medicine.
description: This scholarship rewards international applicants who demonstrate strong academic records. It is applied as a discount to the first year of tuition fees, supporting the university's mission to foster a diverse and inclusive international student body in Kent.

name: Vice-Chancellor’s International Scholarship
requirements: Must be an international fee-payer; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate program; must have achieved grades equivalent to BBB at A-Level; automatic assessment upon receipt of a completed application to the university.
description: A prestigious award for incoming undergraduates at Cardiff Met. It provides a partial tuition fee reduction for the first year of study, aimed at attracting academically gifted students to its professional and creative campus.

name: Vice-Chancellor’s International Scholarship
requirements: Available to self-funding international students for taught Master’s programs; hold a minimum 2:1 undergraduate degree or equivalent; automatic assessment during the admissions process; cannot be combined with other Cardiff Met discounts.
description: This postgraduate award recognizes the high caliber of international graduates joining Cardiff Met. It provides a £1,500 reduction in the total tuition fee for a one-year Master's degree, supporting specialization in management, sport, and tech.

name: Vice-Chancellor’s International Scholarship
requirements: Must have applied via UCAS by the January deadline; academic excellence equivalent to AAB at A-Level; must be an international fee-payer; scholarship is awarded as a fee credit for the first year only.
description: Cardiff University's primary merit award for international undergraduates. It is designed to attract top-tier global talent to this Russell Group institution, providing financial support to students who have demonstrated significant academic dedication.

name: Vice-Chancellor’s International Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time taught Master’s degree; hold a first-class honors degree or international equivalent; separate application often required including a 500-word statement on academic and career aspirations.
description: A high-value scholarship for international postgraduates entering Cardiff University. It aims to support exceptional global graduates in pursuing advanced research and taught programs within one of the UK’s leading research universities.

name: Global Leaders Scholarship
requirements: Must be a new international student for a taught Master’s (excluding MBA); hold a 2:1 or 1st class degree; separate application including a 500-word essay on leadership and impact; interview may be required for top-tier candidates.
description: Following the merger of City and St George's, this award recognizes future leaders in business, health, and law. It provides a significant tuition reduction for the 2026 academic year to graduates who demonstrate the potential to influence global policy and practice.

name: President's International Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; academic excellence equivalent to AAA at A-Level; automatic assessment for eligible regions; students must be self-funded international fee payers.
description: A merit-based award for high-achieving international undergraduates entering City St George's. It provides a tuition fee credit for the first year of study, specifically targeting students who elevate the academic profile of the incoming 2026 cohort.

name: International Academic Expansion Scholarship
requirements: Must be a self-funded international student; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate program at Coventry or CU campuses; academic achievement equivalent to ABB at A-Level; must have paid the tuition deposit by the specified deadline.
description: A merit-based award designed to support the global expansion of Coventry's student body. It provides a £2,000 reduction in the first year of tuition fees for students who demonstrate strong academic potential and meet the deposit payment milestones for 2026.

name: International Academic Expansion Scholarship
requirements: Available for self-funding international students on a full-time taught Master's; hold a minimum 2:1 undergraduate degree or equivalent; automatic assessment during the admissions process; applicable to January and September 2026 intakes.
description: Recognizing the academic caliber of international graduates, this scholarship offers a one-off £2,000 tuition fee reduction. It aims to make advanced study in business, health, and engineering more accessible to high-performing global applicants.

name: Cranfield Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time Master's in Engineering or Science; separate application form required; 500-word essay on how your studies will contribute to the UK's industrial strategy; minimum 1st class honors or equivalent.
description: As a postgraduate-only specialist, Cranfield offers these merit-based awards to attract the world's best technical minds. The scholarship value is tiered based on academic excellence and the quality of the applicant's professional vision statement.

name: Water Sciences Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Admission to MSc Water and Wastewater Engineering or related; 2.1 undergraduate degree; demonstrate passion for global water security; open to both Home and International fee payers for the 2026 intake.
description: Dedicated to the next generation of environmental leaders, this £5,000 award supports students specializing in critical water infrastructure. It is funded by industry partners to address global challenges in sanitation and water management.

name: DMU International Scholarship
requirements: Available to self-funding international students; must have accepted a firm offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; awarded on a first-come, first-served basis upon payment of the tuition deposit; academic requirements apply.
description: A standard merit-based award to support international students at De Montfort University. This scholarship provides a £1,500 discount for the first year of study, aimed at encouraging early application and commitment to the Leicester campus.

name: Edge Hill International Scholarship
requirements: Must be a new international student; hold an offer for a full-time BA/BSc degree; based on academic merit equivalent to BBB at A-Level; automatic assessment at the point of admission; cannot be combined with other bursaries.
description: This prestigious award recognizes the high academic standards of international students joining Edge Hill. It provides a £3,000 reduction in the first year of tuition fees, supporting students across education, health, and social sciences.

name: Postgraduate International Scholarship
requirements: Hold an offer for a full-time taught Master’s; minimum 2:1 degree or international equivalent; must be self-funding; automatic assessment upon admission; available for most faculties including Business and Creative Arts.
description: A merit-based award for international postgraduates, providing a £2,000 one-off discount on the total tuition fee. This award facilitates access to Edge Hill's research-led Master's programs for talented graduates from around the globe.

name: Edinburgh Napier International Merit Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate program; academic merit based on high school grades (equivalent to BBB or higher); regional eligibility may apply; automatic assessment at point of offer.
description: Designed to attract high-caliber students to Scotland's capital, this award provides a tiered tuition reduction in the first year. It rewards academic excellence and supports the university's diverse international community in Dundee Street.

name: Edinburgh Napier International Merit Scholarship
requirements: Admission to a full-time taught Master’s degree; minimum 2:1 honors degree or equivalent; self-funding status; automatic assessment during the admissions process; excluded for certain MBA and specialist clinical programs.
description: This merit scholarship provides international postgraduates with a one-off reduction in their tuition fees. It recognizes prior academic achievement and supports talented graduates in transitioning to specialized studies in business, computing, and the creative industries.

name: Falmouth International Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; submission of a 500-word statement on creative aspirations; academic achievement equivalent to BBB at A-Level; must be an international fee payer.
description: A high-value award for exceptional creative talent. This scholarship provides a £5,000 reduction in the first year of tuition to support the most promising international artists, designers, and performers joining Falmouth's creative community.

name: GCU New to GCU Scholarship
requirements: Available to new self-funding international students; must have accepted a firm offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; awarded automatically to students who meet the academic entry requirements.
description: An automatic tuition fee reduction designed to welcome international students to Glasgow. This award provides £2,000 off the first year of study for those joining the University for the Common Good across business, engineering, and health.

name: GCU New to GCU Scholarship
requirements: Hold an offer for a full-time taught Master’s; minimum 2:1 degree or international equivalent; must be self-funding; automatic assessment upon admission; available for January and September 2026 intakes.
description: A merit-based award for international postgraduates, providing a £2,000 one-off discount on the total tuition fee. It supports talented graduates in pursuing advanced studies at GCU's Glasgow or London campuses.

name: Goldsmiths International Scholarship
requirements: Must be an international fee-paying student; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; separate application including a personal statement; merit-based selection focusing on academic and creative achievement.
description: Goldsmiths offers a range of scholarships to support international students from diverse backgrounds. These awards provide tiered tuition fee reductions to attract the world's most academically and creatively gifted students to New Cross.

name: Goldsmiths International Scholarship
requirements: Available to international postgraduate taught applicants; must hold a minimum 2:1 undergraduate degree; separate application required; excludes students receiving full government or employer sponsorship.
description: A prestigious award for international postgraduates aimed at fostering global academic exchange. The scholarship provides a significant reduction in Master's tuition fees for students who demonstrate high potential in humanities, social sciences, and the arts.

name: Harper Adams International Scholarship
requirements: Must be an international fee-payer; hold an offer for an undergraduate degree in Agriculture, Food or Rural sectors; minimum academic requirements apply; selection based on academic merit and passion for the industry.
description: Recognizing the importance of global agriculture, this award supports international students entering Harper Adams. It provides a tuition fee reduction for the first year to encourage students to specialize in rural and agricultural innovation.

name: Hartpury International Merit Scholarship
requirements: International fee payers only; must be entering a full-time undergraduate program; based on academic merit (equivalent to BBB or higher); automatic assessment at the point of offer for most programs.
description: This merit-based award supports international students pursuing degrees in equine, animal, and sports sciences. The scholarship provides a tiered reduction in the first year of tuition fees, recognizing high-performing students from across the globe.

name: Hartpury International Merit Scholarship
requirements: Hold an offer for a full-time taught Master’s degree; hold a minimum 2:1 degree or international equivalent; must be self-funding; automatic assessment upon admission for eligible candidates.
description: Designed to attract top postgraduate talent to Hartpury's research-active community. This award provides a one-off tuition fee reduction for international graduates specializing in animal behavior, sports coaching, or veterinary nursing.

name: HSU International Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Must be a self-funding international student; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate program in health sciences; academic achievement equivalent to BBB at A-Level; must demonstrate commitment to clinical practice in the UK or home country.
description: A merit-based award designed to support the next generation of healthcare professionals. This scholarship provides a tuition fee reduction for the first year of study for international students joining Health Sciences University (formerly AECC University College).

name: Heriot-Watt Merit Scholarship
requirements: Available to new international students; awarded based on academic merit (equivalent to AAB at A-Level); must be self-funding; automatic assessment upon admission for the Edinburgh or Dubai campuses.
description: Heriot-Watt rewards high-achieving international students with a tiered tuition fee reduction. The scholarship is aimed at attracting global talent to its world-class engineering, business, and data science undergraduate programs for 2026.

name: Keele International Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Must be an international fee-payer; awarded for academic excellence (equivalent to AAB at A-Level); separate application form required; available for most undergraduate programs excluding Medicine and Veterinary Science.
description: A prestigious award for incoming undergraduates at Keele. It provides a significant tuition fee reduction for the first year of study, aimed at attracting academically gifted students to its expansive rural campus in Staffordshire.

name: Keele International Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Available to international postgraduate taught applicants; hold a minimum 2:1 or first-class honors degree; separate application required; excludes students on professional health or veterinary programs.
description: This high-value award supports international postgraduates entering Keele University. It provides a £5,000 reduction in the total Master's tuition fee, recognizing global graduates who have demonstrated exceptional academic achievement.

name: King's International Scholarships
requirements: Must have applied to King's via UCAS by the January deadline; outstanding academic profile (A*AA or equivalent); submission of a 500-word statement on 'How you will contribute to the King's community'; separate application required.
description: One of London's most competitive awards, providing £10,000 to the most exceptional international undergraduates. It aims to support students who show leadership potential and a commitment to global problem-solving across all faculties.

name: King's Global Health & Social Justice Scholarship
requirements: Admission to MSc Global Health & Social Justice; resident of a developing nation; hold a 2.1 or 1st class degree; must demonstrate intent to return to home country to work in public health; separate application required.
description: A transformative full-funding award covering 100% of international tuition fees plus a monthly stipend. It is designed to empower health leaders from the Global South to gain advanced skills at King's and apply them to local health crises.

name: Kingston International Scholarship
requirements: Must be an international fee-payer; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; minimum academic requirements (equivalent to BBB at A-Level); separate application required including a 500-word personal statement.
description: Kingston University offers this £5,000 award to support international students from diverse backgrounds. The scholarship is applied as a reduction in the first-year tuition fee for those who demonstrate academic potential and a passion for their subject.

name: Kingston International Scholarship
requirements: Hold an offer for a full-time taught Master's; hold a minimum 2:1 undergraduate degree; separate application required; must be a self-funding student; available for all subject areas including creative arts and business.
description: A merit-based award for international postgraduates, providing a significant discount on the total Master's fee. It is designed to foster an international academic environment and support talented graduates in pursuing advanced studies in London.

name: Lancaster Global Scholarship - Master's
requirements: Must hold a first-class (or equivalent) undergraduate degree; hold an offer for a full-time Postgraduate Taught program (excluding MBA); automatic assessment based on entry grades; must be an overseas fee-payer.
description: Lancaster's flagship merit award for international postgraduates. It provides a significant £5,000 tuition fee waiver in the first year for top-performing global students across science, technology, arts, and social sciences.

name: International Student Scholarship
requirements: Self-funded international student; enrolled in an eligible full-time undergraduate course; assessed as 'Overseas' for fee purposes; automatic assessment during enrollment; paid annually for each year of study.
description: An automatic annual tuition fee reduction for international undergraduates at Leeds Beckett. Designed to reward commitment and make the UK more accessible, providing £1,000 off fees for every year of the degree.

name: Dean of Faculty International Academic Achievement Scholarship
requirements: High academic achievement (AAB at A-level equivalent); must identify suitability in the application statement; IELTS 6.0 (min 5.5 sections); available for undergraduate or graduate-level courses taught at BGU.
description: A prestigious merit award from Bishop Grosseteste University. It offers a 50% tuition fee waiver for high-achieving international students who can demonstrate how they will elevate the academic profile of the Lincoln campus.

name: International Student Scholarship
requirements: Must be an international fee-payer; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate program; automatic assessment based on academic merit; must be a new student to the university.
description: A merit-based award to support international students at Liverpool Hope. It provides a £1,000 reduction in the first year's tuition fees to recognize global academic talent and support student diversity.

name: Vice-Chancellor's Scholarship
requirements: Exceptional academic achievement (A*AA equivalent); separate scholarship application including a 500-word statement; must hold an offer for a full-time UG degree; evidence of leadership and community involvement.
description: LJMU’s most prestigious award for international students, covering full tuition fees for the duration of the undergraduate degree. Aimed at the highest-caliber global students who intend to be ambassadors for the university.

name: International Achievement Scholarship
requirements: Must hold a 2:1 or first-class undergraduate degree; hold an offer for a taught Master's program; automatic assessment; must be a self-funding student from an eligible international region.
description: An automatic tuition fee reduction for high-achieving international postgraduates. This £3,000 award is applied to the first-year fee to attract top global graduates to Liverpool John Moores' specialized research programs.

name: LBS Masters in Management Scholarship
requirements: Admission to the Masters in Management (MiM) program; outstanding academic record; strong leadership potential demonstrated in application essays; GMAT/GRE score above 700 highly recommended.
description: A merit-based scholarship for elite graduates joining London Business School. This award supports the most promising business leaders of the 2026 cohort, reducing the financial barrier to one of the world's top-ranked business programs.

name: Women in Business Scholarship
requirements: Female applicant with an exceptional professional and academic track record; demonstrated commitment to supporting women in business; admission to an LBS postgraduate program; separate essay required.
description: In a move to improve gender diversity in senior leadership, LBS offers significant tuition waivers to high-potential women. This scholarship covers up to 50% of the tuition fees for the duration of the program.

name: International Student Scholarship
requirements: Must be an international fee-payer; hold an offer for an undergraduate degree; 500-word personal statement on career goals; academic achievement equivalent to BBB at A-level or higher.
description: London Metropolitan University provides this £2,500 award to support international students from diverse backgrounds. The scholarship is aimed at students who demonstrate academic merit and a desire to contribute to the London community.

name: Vice-Chancellor’s International Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time BA (Hons) program; international fee-payer status; awarded based on the quality of the creative portfolio and academic merit; must submit a 300-word supporting statement.
description: A prestigious award for creative individuals joining Leeds Arts University. It recognizes high-level artistic potential and supports international students in accessing the UK's only specialist arts university.

name: LSTM MSc Scholarship
requirements: Admission to an MSc program at LSTM; resident of a low or middle-income country; hold a 2.1 or 1st class degree in a related science; 500-word statement on intent to impact global health in home region.
description: A highly competitive full-tuition scholarship for the world's future leaders in tropical medicine. It aims to build research capacity in regions most affected by endemic diseases.

name: International Merit Scholarship
requirements: New international undergraduate student; self-funding status; academic achievement equivalent to BBB at A-Level; automatic assessment at the point of admission for the 2026 intake.
description: An automatic tuition fee reduction for international students at London South Bank University. It is designed to reward academic achievement and support students in the fields of engineering, business, and social sciences.

name: Vice-Chancellor’s International Scholarship
requirements: Must be an international fee-payer; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; minimum academic requirements (equivalent to ABB at A-Level); awarded annually for each year of the degree.
description: A prestigious merit award at Manchester Met providing a £2,000 reduction for every year of study. It targets high-achieving global students looking to study in one of the UK’s most vibrant student cities.

name: Middlesex International Merit Award
requirements: Available for all self-funding international postgraduates; minimum 2:1 degree or equivalent; automatic assessment based on transcripts; must be a new student for the September 2026 or January 2027 intake.
description: An automatic merit award designed to attract top global graduates to Middlesex’s London campus. It serves as a partial tuition credit to assist with the costs of postgraduate study in business, law, and health.

name: Vice-Chancellor’s International Scholarship
requirements: Exceptional academic achievement (A*AA equivalent); separate scholarship application including a statement on global citizenship; must have Newcastle as firm choice on UCAS.
description: Newcastle University’s top merit award for undergraduates. The value is tiered based on academic excellence and is designed to support the university's mission of attracting high-performing global ambassadors.

name: Global Leaders Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; academic excellence (AAA equivalent); separate application including a 500-word essay on leadership and community impact.
description: Awarded to high-achieving international students at Northeastern University London. This scholarship recognizes individuals who demonstrate not only academic brilliance but also the potential to lead in their future careers.

name: Vice-Chancellor's Global Award
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time BA (Hons) degree; international fee-payer status; awarded based on the quality of the creative portfolio and academic merit; must submit a 500-word supporting statement on creative vision.
description: A prestigious award for creative individuals joining Norwich University of the Arts. It recognizes high-level artistic potential and supports international students in accessing specialized arts education in the UK.

name: NTU Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time Master's program; separate application form including a 500-word statement; judged on academic excellence, work experience, and potential contribution to NTU; open to all subjects.
description: One of Nottingham Trent's most generous awards, offering up to 50% off tuition fees for the first year. It is highly competitive and aimed at students who demonstrate exceptional academic and professional backgrounds.

name: International Student Scholarship
requirements: Must be a self-funded international student; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; academic achievement equivalent to ABB at A-Level; must have paid the tuition deposit by the specified deadline.
description: An automatic merit award designed to attract high-achieving international students to Oxford Brookes. It provides a flat-rate discount on first-year tuition for students who secure their place early in the 2026 cycle.

name: Global Talent Scholarship
requirements: Hold an offer for a Master's degree in Law, Business, or Economics; minimum 1st class honors or equivalent; separate application required; must not be receiving a full government scholarship.
description: Awarded by Queen Mary University of London to attract elite global graduates. This scholarship supports students joining a high-ranking Russell Group institution in London, providing a significant reduction in postgraduate fees.

name: International Office Undergraduate Scholarship
requirements: Must be a new international student entering Year 1; self-funding status; awarded based on academic merit (equivalent to AAB at A-Level); no separate application required for most programs as assessment is automatic.
description: Queen's University Belfast offers this annual reduction to high-achieving international undergraduates. The award is applied for each year of study (up to 4 years), totaling up to £12,000 in tuition savings for a standard degree.

name: RVC International Scholarship
requirements: Hold an offer for BSc Biological Sciences or Bioveterinary Sciences; outstanding academic results; separate application with 500-word statement on 'How I will improve global animal welfare'; must be an overseas fee-payer.
description: A competitive merit award for students joining the world-leading Royal Veterinary College. It aims to support international students who demonstrate a passion for veterinary and biological sciences and global health.

name: Transform Together Scholarship
requirements: Exceptional academic achievement; separate application required; must demonstrate leadership and how the student will represent SHU as an ambassador; available for all full-time undergraduate and postgraduate courses.
description: Sheffield Hallam’s flagship award providing a 50% tuition reduction for the first year. It is highly competitive and focuses on students who can prove they will make a significant impact on the university community and their future industry.

name: SOAS International Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time taught Master's program; minimum 1st class honors or equivalent; submission of a 500-word essay on 'Global Challenges and the Role of SOAS'; open to specific regions including Africa and Asia.
description: A prestigious merit-based award designed for global leaders studying at SOAS. It focuses on students specializing in languages, cultures, and societies of Africa, Asia, and the Middle East, recognizing academic brilliance.

name: Excellence in Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for an undergraduate degree; outstanding entry grades (A*AA equivalent); separate application required; must have Swansea University as a firm choice on UCAS; paid over the duration of the degree.
description: Swansea University's highest merit award for undergraduates, rewarding global academic high-flyers. The scholarship provides £2,000 per year for up to three years, totaling £6,000 in tuition fee credits.

name: Buckingham International Scholarship
requirements: Must be a self-funding international student; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate program; academic achievement equivalent to BBB at A-Level; must demonstrate high motivation in a 300-word personal statement.
description: A merit-based award designed to support international students joining the UK's first independent university. This scholarship provides a tuition fee reduction for the first year of study for the 2026 intake.

name: Lord Blunkett International Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time LLB or undergraduate law degree; international fee-payer status; 500-word statement on 'The importance of the rule of law in a globalized society'; academic achievement equivalent to ABB at A-Level.
description: A prestigious award from The University of Law aimed at supporting international students who demonstrate a passion for legal practice and justice. This award provides a first-year tuition fee reduction for the 2026 intake.

name: Northampton International Scholarship
requirements: Available to self-funding international students; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; academic achievement equivalent to BBC at A-Level; automatic assessment upon admission for most programs.
description: An automatic merit award designed to attract high-achieving international students to the University of Northampton. It provides a flat-rate discount on first-year tuition for students who secure their place for the 2026 cycle.

name: Salford International Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; separate application form; 500-word personal statement detailing academic and extracurricular success; available for most faculties including health and engineering.
description: Salford offers this tiered award to support international students from diverse backgrounds. The scholarship is aimed at students who demonstrate academic merit and a desire to contribute to the Greater Manchester community.

name: International Undergraduate Merit Scholarship
requirements: Exceptional academic achievement (A*AA equivalent); separate application including a 500-word statement; must hold an offer for an undergraduate degree; available for all subjects except Medicine and Dentistry.
description: One of Sheffield’s most generous awards, offering a 50% tuition fee waiver for each year of study. It targets the highest-achieving international students globally to promote academic excellence and diversity within the Sheffield cohort.

name: International Ambassador Scholarship
requirements: Must be an international fee-payer; hold an offer for an undergraduate degree; 500-word statement on how you will act as a university ambassador; academic achievement equivalent to BBB at A-level or higher.
description: University of West London provides this competitive award to support students who will promote the university globally. The scholarship is aimed at students who demonstrate academic merit and strong leadership potential.

name: Worcester International Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; academic merit based on high school grades (equivalent to BBB or higher); automatic assessment at point of offer for most programs.
description: This merit-based award supports international students pursuing degrees in education, health, and social sciences. The scholarship provides a tiered reduction in the first year of tuition fees, recognizing high-performing students.

name: UCL Global Undergraduate Scholarship
eligibility: International (Non-EU) fee status from low-income backgrounds
requirements: Financial need (household income below £25,000 equivalent); hold an offer for a full-time UG degree; academic merit; separate application via the UCL scholarship portal including evidence of financial status.
description: A transformative award covering full tuition fees and living costs for the duration of the degree. It is designed to enable exceptionally talented international students from disadvantaged backgrounds to access world-class education at UCL.

name: UCL Global Masters Scholarship
eligibility: International (Non-EU) fee status from low-income backgrounds
requirements: Evidence of financial hardship; admission to a full-time Master's program; minimum 2:1 undergraduate degree; separate application required; must be a new student to UCL.
description: This scholarship aims to support international postgraduates who would otherwise be unable to fund their studies at UCL. It provides a significant one-off payment of £15,000 towards the total cost of tuition.

name: UCA Creative Europe/International Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time BA (Hons) degree; high-quality digital portfolio; 500-word statement on 'The future of the creative industries'; academic achievement equivalent to BBC at A-Level.
description: Designed for exceptional creative talent joining the University for the Creative Arts. This award recognizes artistic potential and provides a reduction in the first year of tuition for 2026 entry.

name: Aberdeen Global Scholarship
requirements: Must be a self-funding international fee payer; hold an offer for a taught Master's program; value tiered based on the applicant's country of residence and academic merit (minimum 2:1 equivalent).
description: A tiered tuition fee reduction designed to help make postgraduate study in Scotland more affordable. The award is applied directly to the fee and varies based on the student's geographic region and prior grades.

name: Chancellor's Scholarship
requirements: Exceptional academic achievement equivalent to A*A*A at A-Level; must have applied via UCAS by the January deadline; automatic assessment for eligible candidates; limited to specific faculties including Science and Engineering.
description: This prestigious award recognizes the highest academic achievers entering the University of Bath. It provides a £2,000 tuition reduction for the first year of study, rewarding students who excel in STEM disciplines.

name: Global Masters Scholarship
eligibility: International (Non-EU) fee status from specific regions
requirements: Must be a resident of an eligible country (e.g. India, Nigeria, USA); hold an offer for a full-time taught Master's; academic achievement (equivalent to 1st class honors); automatic assessment upon admission.
description: Birmingham offers these region-specific awards to attract top global graduates. The scholarship recognizes academic excellence and is applied as a credit toward the total tuition fee for the 2026/27 academic year.

name: Vice-Chancellor's Award for Excellence
requirements: International fee payer; admission to an undergraduate degree; academic merit based on high school transcripts; 500-word personal statement; available for China, India, Nigeria, and Pakistan applicants.
description: A targeted merit award at the University of Bradford designed to support students from key international regions. The award provides a substantial fee reduction for the first year of study in technology and management faculties.

name: Think Big Undergraduate Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; separate application form; 3 essays (200 words each) on leadership, career goals, and community impact; available for all subjects except clinical programs.
description: Bristol's flagship international scheme. It offers substantial tuition fee waivers of up to £13,000 per year for the duration of the degree, aimed at students who demonstrate they can 'Think Big' and impact the world.

name: Think Big Postgraduate Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time taught Master's; separate application including impact essays; hold a minimum 2:1 degree or equivalent; tiered award values including some full-tuition waivers.
description: A highly competitive award for international postgraduates at Bristol. It provides significant tuition credits (up to £26,000) to support global graduates who show promise in leadership and academic research across all faculties.

name: Cambridge Trust International Scholarships
requirements: Admission to a Cambridge College; exceptional academic achievement (A*A*A* equivalent); high financial need; separate application usually required via the COPA or UCAS portal; available for all disciplines.
description: A world-class scholarship covering 100% of international tuition fees and a monthly living stipend. Awarded to the absolute highest tier of global applicants to Cambridge who demonstrate potential for transformative leadership.

name: Gates Cambridge Scholarship
requirements: Admission to a PhD or Master's program; outstanding intellectual ability; leadership potential; commitment to improving the lives of others; separate application including a 500-word statement and reference.
description: One of the world's most prestigious postgraduate awards. It provides full cost-of-attendance (fees and maintenance) for talented graduates from outside the UK to pursue advanced study and research at the University of Cambridge.

name: UCLan Global Merit Scholarship
requirements: Must be a self-funding international student; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; academic achievement equivalent to BBB at A-Level; no separate application required as assessment is automatic based on admission documents.
description: A merit-based award designed to support international students joining the University of Central Lancashire. The scholarship provides a flat-rate reduction in the first-year tuition fee to recognize academic potential and support global student diversity.

name: International Undergraduate Merit Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; academic excellence equivalent to AAB at A-Level; separate application required including a personal statement; available for Engineering, Business, and Science faculties.
description: A prestigious merit award at the University of Leeds. It provides a £2,500 reduction in the first-year tuition fee for students who have demonstrated significant academic dedication and potential to represent the university globally.

name: Citizens of the World Scholarship
requirements: International fee-payer status; hold an offer for an undergraduate degree; 500-word statement on 'How you will change the world'; tiered award based on academic achievement (AAB or higher).
description: Leicester's primary award for international students who demonstrate not only academic brilliance but a commitment to global citizenship. The scholarship provides a tiered reduction in the first-year tuition fee.

name: Vice-Chancellor's International Attainment Scholarship
requirements: Available for all non-clinical undergraduate programs; must have achieved grades equivalent to AAB at A-Level; automatic assessment at the point of admission; must be a self-funded international student.
description: This award recognizes the high academic standards of international students joining the University of Liverpool. It provides a £3,000 reduction in the first-year tuition fee to support students across the Humanities and Sciences.

name: Global Futures Scholarship
eligibility: International (Non-EU) fee status from selected countries
requirements: Must be a resident of an eligible country (e.g. India, Nigeria, USA); hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; academic excellence (AAA equivalent); separate application required via the university portal.
description: Manchester’s premier international merit award. It provides £5,000 per year for up to three years (total £15,000), targeting high-performing students who intend to use their Manchester education to impact their home regions.

name: Global Futures Scholarship
eligibility: International (Non-EU) fee status from selected countries
requirements: Hold an offer for a full-time taught Master's; hold a minimum 2:1 undergraduate degree; separate application including a 500-word impact statement; available for most subject areas in Humanities and Science.
description: A high-value award for international postgraduates entering Manchester. It aims to support exceptional global graduates in pursuing advanced taught programs, providing a significant reduction in total Master's tuition fees.

name: International Undergraduate Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Academic achievement equivalent to AAB at A-Level; separate application including a 500-word statement on academic and extracurricular success; available for most undergraduate programs.
description: Nottingham offers tiered tuition reductions to reward international high-flyers. This award recognizes academic potential and helps talented students access the university's research-led environment and global community.

name: Clarendon Fund Scholarship
requirements: Admission to an Oxford Master's or DPhil program; outstanding academic record; high potential for future research; no separate application required as all eligible candidates are automatically considered via their course application.
description: Oxford's flagship graduate scholarship scheme. It covers 100% of course fees and provides a generous annual grant for living costs (stipend) for the duration of the degree, supporting the brightest minds from across the world.

name: Reach Oxford Scholarship
requirements: Financial need; resident of a developing nation; hold an offer for a full-time UG degree; academic excellence (A*AA equivalent); separate application required after receiving a course offer.
description: A transformative award covering full tuition fees, a living stipend, and an annual return airfare. It is designed to enable exceptionally talented students from low-income countries to access an Oxford undergraduate education.

name: Rhodes Scholarship
requirements: Graduating seniors or recent graduates; outstanding intellectual ability; character and leadership; separate, highly competitive application process including interviews; age and residency restrictions apply.
description: The oldest and arguably most prestigious international scholarship in the world. It provides full funding for two or more years of study at Oxford, bringing together young leaders of extraordinary character to tackle global challenges.

name: International Academic Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; academic achievement equivalent to AAB at A-Level; separate application required including a personal statement; must maintain a high grade average for renewal.
description: A prestigious merit-based award designed to recognize and reward exceptionally high-achieving international students entering the University of Plymouth. The scholarship covers half of the tuition fees for the first year of study.

name: Vice-Chancellor's Global Development Scholarship
eligibility: International (Non-EU) fee status from selected regions
requirements: Must be a self-funding student from an eligible region (e.g. South Asia, SE Asia, Africa); hold an offer for a full-time campus-based undergraduate degree; automatic assessment based on the application for admission.
description: This scholarship aims to support global diversity and development at the University of Portsmouth. It provides a flat-rate reduction in the first-year tuition fee for students from developing regions.

name: Vice-Chancellor's Global Development Scholarship
eligibility: International (Non-EU) fee status from selected regions
requirements: Hold an offer for a full-time taught Master's program; minimum 2:2 undergraduate degree equivalent; automatic assessment at the point of admission; applicable to first-year tuition fees only for campus-based courses.
description: A targeted financial award for international postgraduates entering Portsmouth. It is designed to reduce the financial barrier for talented graduates from selected international regions, fostering an inclusive academic community.

name: Reading Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time taught Master's; academic achievement equivalent to a UK 2:1 or First Class degree; tiered award value based on the strength of the previous academic record; separate application form required.
description: The University of Reading's primary postgraduate award for international students. It offers significant tuition fee reductions to reward academic excellence, with the highest values reserved for students demonstrating exceptional potential.

name: Chancellor's International Development Scholarship
eligibility: International (Non-EU) fee status from India, Africa, and SE Asia
requirements: Must be a self-funding student from an eligible country; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; no separate application required as assessment is automatic upon admission; must be for on-campus study.
description: A developmental award from the University of South Wales designed to support students from key global regions. It provides a significant reduction in first-year tuition fees to help students transition into the UK higher education system.

name: Southampton International Merit Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for an undergraduate degree within the Faculty of Arts, Humanities, or Engineering; academic achievement equivalent to A*AA at A-Level; automatic assessment at the point of admission.
description: Recognizing the academic caliber of global applicants, this merit-based scholarship provides a £3,000 discount on the first year's tuition fees at the University of Southampton, specifically targeting high-performers in technical and creative fields.

name: International Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Separate application required including a 500-word statement on leadership; must hold an offer for a full-time UG degree; academic excellence equivalent to AAA at A-Level; highly competitive selection process.
description: St Andrews' premier award for international undergraduates. It targets students who demonstrate not only academic brilliance but also the potential to be a global leader, providing a substantial reduction in annual tuition fees.

name: Marjon International Scholarship
requirements: Must hold a conditional or unconditional offer; assessed through the application personal statement; academic achievement equivalent to BCC at A-level; must be an international fee payer.
description: A bursary at St Mark & St John (Marjon) designed to support international undergraduate students with the costs of studying in Plymouth. The award is based on academic potential and the strength of the personal statement.

name: Marjon International Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a Taught Master's; minimum 2:2 honors degree or equivalent; assessed through the postgraduate application statement; available for most taught Master's programs.
description: This award provides financial support for international postgraduate students entering Marjon. It aims to increase campus diversity and support talented graduates in pursuing further specialization in the UK.

name: SMART Scholarship
requirements: Must be a self-funding international student; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; academic achievement equivalent to a 2:1 at A-Level; automatic assessment based on admission documents.
description: The Staffordshire Merit Award for Regional Talent (SMART) is designed to recognize and support high-achieving global students. It provides a £2,000 reduction in the first-year tuition fee for students across all undergraduate faculties.

name: Postgraduate International Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Hold an offer for a full-time taught Master's; hold a minimum 2:1 undergraduate degree equivalent; automatic assessment based on previous academic qualifications; applicable for all Stirling Master's programs.
description: Stirling offers this significant tuition reduction to reward international graduates with a strong academic track record. The award aims to assist talented students in pursuing advanced degrees within the university's research-led environment.

name: Strathclyde Business School Masters Scholarship
requirements: Hold an offer for a full-time Master's in the Business School; minimum 2:1 undergraduate degree; separate application including a personal statement on career goals; selection based on academic and professional experience.
description: One of Glasgow's most valuable business awards, this scholarship provides a significant fee reduction for international postgraduates. It aims to support the next generation of global business leaders entering Strathclyde's triple-accredited school.

name: International Undergraduate Scholarship
requirements: Must be a self-funding student; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; automatic assessment based on admission documents; must be an international fee payer.
description: A merit-based award designed to support international students joining the University of Suffolk. The scholarship provides a flat-rate reduction in the first-year tuition fee to recognize academic potential.

name: International Academic Masters Scholarship
requirements: Hold an offer for a full-time taught Master's program; minimum 2:2 honors degree or equivalent; automatic award for new self-funding postgraduate students based on academic merit.
description: A standard award at the University of Sunderland to reduce the cost of postgraduate study. This merit-based award helps talented international graduates pursue advanced research and specialized education in the UK.

name: International Excellence Award
requirements: Hold an offer for a full-time taught Master's; academic excellence equivalent to a UK 1st Class degree; separate application form required via the Surrey online portal; available for most subject areas except clinical courses.
description: Surrey's flagship postgraduate award, providing a £5,000 reduction in tuition fees. It is designed to attract the highest tier of global graduates to Guildford, fostering an international environment of research and innovation.

name: Chancellor's International Scholarship
requirements: Academic achievement equivalent to a UK 1st Class degree; hold an offer for a full-time Master's; separate application including a personal statement on academic goals; highly competitive and awarded based on merit.
description: A prestigious award at the University of Sussex, providing a significant reduction in Master's fees for the brightest international minds. It rewards academic excellence and targets students who will contribute to the university's research culture.

name: UAL International Postgraduate Scholarship
requirements: Hold an offer for an eligible MA/MSc; must be a resident of a qualifying low-income nation; demonstrated financial need; separate application including a creative portfolio and personal statement.
description: A transformative full-funding award covering 100% of tuition fees and providing a generous living stipend. It is designed to enable the most creative minds from developing countries to access a world-leading arts education in London.

name: UHI International Undergraduate Scholarship
requirements: Selection based on personal statement provided during the admissions process; must be for full-time undergraduate study; academic equivalent of BBC at A-level.
description: Awards provided to support undergraduate students studying across the Highlands and Islands network. This scholarship is tiered based on academic merit and the candidate's potential to contribute to the UHI community.

name: Chancellor's Scholarship
requirements: Academic excellence equivalent to a UK 1st Class degree; hold an offer for a full-time taught Master's; separate application required; must be willing to act as a student ambassador for the university.
description: UWE Bristol's premier postgraduate award. It provides a massive 50% discount on tuition fees for one year, targeting exceptional international graduates who have both academic brilliance and a commitment to representing the university globally.

name: UWS Global Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Awarded automatically upon offer of study based on previous qualifications (GPA 3.0+ equivalent); must be for full-time undergraduate study; available for on-campus programs.
description: A merit-based incentive to support high-achieving international undergraduate students at UWS. This award recognizes previous academic achievement and supports talented students in accessing higher education in Scotland.

name: International Undergraduate Scholarship
requirements: Must be a self-funding international student; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; automatic assessment based on admission; applicable to all four campuses in Northern Ireland.
description: A standard merit-based award designed to support international students joining Ulster University. It provides a consistent flat-rate reduction in tuition fees for the first year of undergraduate study to help students settle into their new environment.

name: International Bursary
requirements: Available for all self-funding international students; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; automatically applied to the tuition fee invoice; no separate application required.
description: A guaranteed financial support award at the University of Wales Trinity St David. It provides a £2,000 reduction in tuition fees to make studying in Wales more accessible for the global student community.

name: International Bursary
requirements: Hold an offer for a full-time taught Master's; self-funding international student status; automatically applied to postgraduate fee invoices; valid for all campus locations in Wales and London.
description: This award ensures that international postgraduates receive consistent financial support when entering UWTSD. The bursary provides a flat-rate reduction in Master's tuition fees to assist with the costs of postgraduate research and study.

name: Warwick Undergraduate Global Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; academic excellence equivalent to A*A*A at A-Level; separate application required including a 400-word statement on academic ambition and global contribution; highly competitive selection.
description: A tiered award designed to reward exceptional academic achievement in international undergraduate applicants. The scholarship provides a significant reduction in tuition fees for each year of the degree to support the world's brightest minds at Warwick.

name: Albukhary Undergraduate Scholarship
eligibility: International fee status from selected developing countries
requirements: Must demonstrate significant financial need; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; academic excellence (AAA equivalent); separate application required focusing on community impact and leadership potential.
description: A transformative scholarship that provides a substantial tuition fee reduction and a living stipend for students from developing nations who would otherwise be unable to afford a Warwick education.

name: Great Start Undergraduate Scholarship
requirements: Available for students from specific regions (India, Nigeria, Vietnam); hold a full-time undergraduate offer; academic achievement equivalent to BBB at A-Level; no separate application required as assessment is automatic.
description: This award is designed to provide an initial financial boost for international students entering Westminster. It helps reduce the first-year tuition fee, encouraging students from key global markets to join the London academic community.

name: International Postgraduate Part Fee Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time taught Master's; minimum 2:1 undergraduate degree equivalent; separate application required via the university portal including a statement on academic goals and financial need.
description: A competitive merit award for international postgraduates entering the University of Westminster. It provides a flat-rate reduction in Master's tuition fees to attract talented graduates from around the world.

name: Lord Paul Undergraduate Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Must be a self-funding international student; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; tiered award based on academic achievement (ABB or higher equivalent); automatic assessment at point of admission.
description: Named after the University's Chancellor, this award supports international undergraduates at Wolverhampton. It provides a tuition fee discount to reward academic excellence and help students with the cost of living in the UK.

name: Lord Paul Postgraduate Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Hold an offer for a full-time taught Master's; minimum 2:2 undergraduate degree equivalent; automatic assessment based on transcripts submitted during the application process; applicable to first-year fees only.
description: A dedicated scholarship for international Master's students at Wolverhampton. The award recognizes postgraduate potential and provides a significant reduction in tuition fees to make advanced study more accessible.

name: Be Exceptional Undergraduate Scholarship
requirements: Must hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; academic excellence equivalent to AAB at A-Level; separate application required including a personal statement on 'How a York degree will help you change the world'.
description: York's premier undergraduate merit award. It provides a tiered reduction in tuition fees for each year of study, targeting high-performing students who demonstrate a commitment to making a positive global impact.

name: York Graduate Loyalty Scholarship
requirements: Must have successfully completed an undergraduate degree at the University of York; hold an offer for a full-time taught Master's; automatic application of discount to the postgraduate tuition fee invoice.
description: A significant financial incentive for York's own graduates to continue their education at the postgraduate level. The 20% discount on tuition fees rewards alumni loyalty and supports continued academic growth.

name: Wrexham International Merit Scholarship
requirements: Available for self-funding international students; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; academic achievement equivalent to BCC at A-Level; automatic assessment upon admission.
description: A merit-based award designed to make higher education in Wales more affordable. It provides a flat-rate reduction in first-year tuition fees for students entering Wrexham University from global backgrounds.

name: Wrexham International Merit Scholarship
requirements: Hold an offer for a full-time taught Master's; minimum 2:2 undergraduate degree equivalent; automatic assessment based on academic qualifications; valid for all postgraduate taught courses.
description: This award ensures that international postgraduates receive consistent financial support. The scholarship provides a £2,000 reduction in Master's fees to recognize academic achievement and support specialized research.

name: Global Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Must be a self-funding international student; hold an offer for a full-time undergraduate degree; automatic assessment based on admission; must be an international fee payer.
description: A merit-based bursary designed to support international students joining York St John University. It provides a flat-rate reduction in tuition fees to recognize potential and support campus diversity.

name: Global Excellence Scholarship
requirements: Hold an offer for a full-time taught Master's; minimum 2:2 undergraduate degree equivalent; automatic assessment based on previous qualifications; valid for York and London campus locations.
description: A consistent financial support award for international postgraduates entering York St John. The scholarship provides a flat-rate reduction in Master's tuition fees to assist with the costs of postgraduate study in the UK.
